We’re excited for this week’s #FeatureFriday highlighting our new assistant principal at Bexley Middle School, Ms. Armstrong! We invite you to read about Ms. Armstrong and what #BexleyBold means to her.

𝑪𝒖𝒓𝒓𝒆𝒏𝒕 𝒓𝒐𝒍𝒆 𝒂𝒕 𝑩𝒆𝒙𝒍𝒆𝒚 𝑪𝒊𝒕𝒚 𝑺𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍𝒔: Assistant Principal at Bexley Middle School

𝑯𝒐𝒘 𝒍𝒐𝒏𝒈 𝑰’𝒗𝒆 𝒃𝒆𝒆𝒏 𝒂𝒕 𝑩𝒆𝒙𝒍𝒆𝒚 𝑪𝒊𝒕𝒚 𝑺𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍𝒔: One month

𝑯𝒐𝒎𝒆𝒕𝒐𝒘𝒏: Cleveland, Ohio

𝑬𝒅𝒖𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏: Bachelor of Arts from Wellesley College, Master of Science in Education from University of Pennsylvania, Master of Business Administration from Fisher College of Business, and currently completing Doctor of Philosophy in Multi-cultural and Equity Studies from The Ohio State University.

𝑭𝒂𝒎𝒊𝒍𝒚: I have 5 Godchildren - Brooke, Kaleb, Emma, Jaydah, and Zoe.

𝑯𝒐𝒃𝒃𝒊𝒆𝒔: I love fitness, performing poetry, and cooking gourmet meals.

𝑾𝒉𝒂𝒕 𝒅𝒐𝒆𝒔 #𝑩𝒆𝒙𝒍𝒆𝒚𝑩𝒐𝒍𝒅 𝒎𝒆𝒂𝒏 𝒕𝒐 𝒚𝒐𝒖?: Growth mindset to bravely engage in difficult conversations and take academic and professional risks to grow individually and collectively as a community.

Ms. Armstrong, we are grateful to have you here! #BexleyBold

Today, we’re excited for you to learn more about one of our classroom aides, Nicolette Romano! 👩‍🏫 Read more about Ms. Romano below!
𝑹𝒐𝒍𝒆: Second grade classroom aide at Maryland Elementary

𝑯𝒐𝒘 𝒂𝒓𝒆 𝒚𝒐𝒖 𝒄𝒐𝒏𝒏𝒆𝒄𝒕𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒘𝒊𝒕𝒉 𝒔𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔 𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝒎𝒂𝒙𝒊𝒎𝒊𝒛𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒍𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒏𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒅𝒖𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒔𝒆 𝒖𝒏𝒑𝒓𝒆𝒄𝒆𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒅 𝒕𝒊𝒎𝒆𝒔? I have been emailing my students weekly, and sometimes, daily!

𝑾𝒉𝒂𝒕 𝒊𝒔 𝒔𝒐𝒎𝒆𝒕𝒉𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒚𝒐𝒖 𝒉𝒂𝒗𝒆 𝒍𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒏𝒆𝒅 𝒂𝒃𝒐𝒖𝒕 𝒚𝒐𝒖𝒓𝒔𝒆𝒍𝒇 𝒕𝒉𝒓𝒐𝒖𝒈𝒉 𝒕𝒉𝒊𝒔 𝒆𝒙𝒑𝒆𝒓𝒊𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆? I need the children just as much as they need me.

𝑨𝒅𝒗𝒊𝒄𝒆 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒔𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔 𝒂𝒔 𝒘𝒆 𝒇𝒂𝒄𝒆 𝒕𝒉𝒊𝒔 𝒆𝒙𝒑𝒆𝒓𝒊𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆 𝒕𝒐𝒈𝒆𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒓: Laugh! I like to laugh everyday. Even when I am going through a hard time, I will always find something to laugh about.

𝑰 𝒍𝒐𝒗𝒆 𝑩𝒆𝒙𝒍𝒆𝒚 𝑪𝒊𝒕𝒚 𝑺𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍𝒔 𝒃𝒆𝒄𝒂𝒖𝒔𝒆: ... we are a family!

Thank you Ms. Romano for all you do! We are grateful to have you! 🏫 🦁 #BexleyBold

𝑹𝒐𝒍𝒆: Second grade classroom aide at Maryland Elementary

𝑯𝒐𝒘 𝒂𝒓𝒆 𝒚𝒐𝒖 𝒄𝒐𝒏𝒏𝒆𝒄𝒕𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒘𝒊𝒕𝒉 𝒔𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔 𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝒎𝒂𝒙𝒊𝒎𝒊𝒛𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒍𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒏𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒅𝒖𝒓𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒔𝒆 𝒖𝒏𝒑𝒓𝒆𝒄𝒆𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒅 𝒕𝒊𝒎𝒆𝒔? I have been emailing my students weekly, and sometimes, daily!

𝑾𝒉𝒂𝒕 𝒊𝒔 𝒔𝒐𝒎𝒆𝒕𝒉𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒚𝒐𝒖 𝒉𝒂𝒗𝒆 𝒍𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒏𝒆𝒅 𝒂𝒃𝒐𝒖𝒕 𝒚𝒐𝒖𝒓𝒔𝒆𝒍𝒇 𝒕𝒉𝒓𝒐𝒖𝒈𝒉 𝒕𝒉𝒊𝒔 𝒆𝒙𝒑𝒆𝒓𝒊𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆? I need the children just as much as they need me.

𝑨𝒅𝒗𝒊𝒄𝒆 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒔𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔 𝒂𝒔 𝒘𝒆 𝒇𝒂𝒄𝒆 𝒕𝒉𝒊𝒔 𝒆𝒙𝒑𝒆𝒓𝒊𝒆𝒏𝒄𝒆 𝒕𝒐𝒈𝒆𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒓: Laugh! I like to laugh everyday. Even when I am going through a hard time, I will always find something to laugh about.

𝑰 𝒍𝒐𝒗𝒆 𝑩𝒆𝒙𝒍𝒆𝒚 𝑪𝒊𝒕𝒚 𝑺𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍𝒔 𝒃𝒆𝒄𝒂𝒖𝒔𝒆: ... we are a family!

Thank you Ms. Romano for all you do! We are grateful to have you! 🏫 🦁 #BexleyBold

We are so 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙣𝙠𝙛𝙪𝙡 for our healthcare providers and those that are putting their own safety aside to help during the COVID-19 pandemic. We loved hearing directly from two doctors in 𝙋𝙧𝙖𝙘𝙩𝙞𝙘𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙈𝙚𝙙𝙞𝙘𝙞𝙣𝙚 𝘿𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙖 𝙋𝙖𝙣𝙙𝙚𝙢𝙞𝙘, hosted by our very own Experiential Learning Coordinator Steve Shapiro.

This event features Bexley emergency medicine doctor Michael Weinstock and family practice doctor Beth Weinstock. They speak about what it’s been like practicing medicine in the face of the COVID-19 virus. Specifically, their experience of treating patients, the fears of exposure, the emotional toll on doctors and others in the medical profession, and the ways in which our medical system is or isn't prepared for this crisis.

Thank you to both doctors who participated! We hope you enjoy hearing from them as much as we did! 💙 #BexleyBold

It's Friday and we are back with our next staff member for this week’s #FeatureFriday. Today, we are excited to learn a little more about Lisa Viney!

𝑹𝒐𝒍𝒆: Visual Art Teacher at Maryland Elementary 🎨🖼️

𝑻𝒊𝒎𝒆 𝒘𝒊𝒕𝒉 𝑩𝒆𝒙𝒍𝒆𝒚 𝑪𝒊𝒕𝒚 𝑺𝒄𝒉𝒐𝒐𝒍𝒔: Lisa has been with us for 18 years!

𝑬𝒅𝒖𝒄𝒂𝒕𝒊𝒐𝒏: Lisa earned her BFA and Masters from The Ohio State University.

𝑭𝒂𝒎𝒊𝒍𝒚: Her family includes her husband, 2 sons, and their dog!

𝑯𝒐𝒃𝒃𝒊𝒆𝒔: Recently, in fact very recently, Lisa has taken up golf as a new hobby! ⛳

Lisa, we are so happy you have been part of our community for so many years. Thank you for sharing your talents each and every day, and for the impact you have on our students’ experience!

post_text: This one may make you hungry, but it’s so worth it! Students in Ms. Lund’s Latin II class built completely edible models of Roman houses to wrap up their unit on the house. Using an abundance of Halloween candy, students were able to make the projects all their own! They discovered some innovative uses of different candies to represent different parts of the house. When Jill Abraham and Steve Shapiro stopped by to hand out superlatives to each group, the students clearly explained the different parts of their houses, demonstrating their understanding of the functions of the different rooms and areas. Impressive! 🍫🍬🍭 #BexleyBold

The safety of our students and staff is a top priority for the district. Bexley Schools take the necessary steps every day to provide environments that are not only optimal for learning, but are safe and secure.

Bexley City School District invites you to attend The State of School Safety and Security on Monday, November 25, 2019, from 7:00 p.m. to 8:30 p.m in the Cassingham Theater. Director of Operations, Dr. Harley Williams, will discuss the past, present, and future actions and plans related to crisis management and responses.

There will be time for questions, but we ask for you to email your questions ahead of time to Harley.Williams@bexley.us. Please use the email subject “State of School Safety and Security Question.” #BexleyBold
